<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 221, 919, 238]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[623, 220, 722, 248]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[51, 262, 80, 280]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 279, 349, 294]]<|/det|> ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 304, 269, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 1 Non-calculator <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 304, 919, 319]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 330, 905, 343]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 396, 372]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 361, 401]]<|/det|> No additional materials are needed. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 419, 225, 432]]<|/det|> INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 294, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 466]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 481, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 451, 544]]<|/det|> - Calculators must not be used in this paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 468, 559]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 589, 214, 602]]<|/det|> INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 388, 620]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 80. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 620, 730, 635]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 567, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[601, 102, 783, 124]]<|/det|>
\[
(x-a)^{2}+(y-b)^{2}=r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 105, 477, 124]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 157, 672, 173]]<|/det|>
\(A=\pi r l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 157, 537, 174]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 203, 374, 220]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 199, 686, 218]]<|/det|>
\[
A=4 \pi r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 244, 682, 274]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{1}{3} A h
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 290, 686, 321]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 206, 374, 221]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 298, 338, 315]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 347, 236, 364]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 445, 225, 460]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 552, 220, 568]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 449, 908, 524]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{array}{r}
(a+b)^{n}=a^{n}+\binom{n}{1} a^{n-1} b+\binom{n}{2} a^{n-2} b^{2}+\cdots+\binom{n}{r} a^{n-r} b^{r}+\ldots+b^{n}, \\
\text { where } n \text { is a positive integer and } \binom{n}{r}=\frac{n !}{(n-r) ! r !}
\end{array}
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 552, 669, 595]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a+(n-1) d \\
& S_{n}=\frac{1}{2} n(a+l)=\frac{1}{2} n\{2 a+(n-1) d\}
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 630, 220, 647]]<|/det|>
Geometric series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 628, 573, 710]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a r^{n-1} \\
& S_{n}=\frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r} \quad(r \neq 1) \\
& S_{\infty}=\frac{a}{1-r} \quad(|r|<1)
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 739, 160, 754]]<|/det|>
Identities

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 736, 556, 788]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \sin ^{2} A+\cos ^{2} A=1 \\
& \sec ^{2} A=1+\tan ^{2} A \\
& \operatorname{cosec}^{2} A=1+\cot ^{2} A
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 827, 240, 845]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta A B C\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 821, 579, 900]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \frac{a}{\sin A}=\frac{b}{\sin B}=\frac{c}{\sin C} \\
& a^{2}=b^{2}+c^{2}-2 b c \cos A \\
& \Delta=\frac{1}{2} a b \sin C
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 103, 590, 140]]<|/det|>
1 (a) Given that \(\overrightarrow{P Q}=\binom{-3}{7}\) and \(4 \overrightarrow{P R}=\binom{-2}{8}\), find \(\overrightarrow{R Q}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 423, 918, 440]]<|/det|>
(b) The vectors \(\mathbf{a}, \mathbf{b}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\) are such that \(\mathbf{a}=\alpha \mathbf{i}+6 \mathbf{j}, \quad \mathbf{b}=4 \mathbf{i}+\beta \mathbf{j} \quad\) and \(\quad \mathbf{c}=(2 \alpha+5 \beta) \mathbf{i}+20 \mathbf{j}\), where \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\) are scalars.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 468, 565, 485]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathbf{c}=3 \mathbf{a}-2 \mathbf{b}\), find the values of \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 369, 91]]<|/det|>
3 Point \(A\) has coordinates \((3,-1)\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 97, 471, 122]]<|/det|>
A circle has equation \((x-4)^{2}+(y+3)^{2}=5\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 139, 556, 157]]<|/det|>
（a）Show that \(A\) lies on the circumference of the circle．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 263, 678, 279]]<|/det|>
（b）Given that \(A B\) is a diameter of the circle，find the coordinates of \(B\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 617, 543, 635]]<|/det|>
（c）Find the equation of the tangent to the circle at \(A\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 413, 99]]<|/det|>
4 (a) Solve the equation \(x^{\frac{1}{3}}-x^{\frac{1}{6}}=2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 406, 421, 423]]<|/det|>
(b) Solve the simultaneous equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 423, 570, 466]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{array}{r}
\lg (x+2 y)=0 \\
x^{2}+4 x y+y=1
\end{array}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 78, 465, 95]]<|/det|>
5 (a) Solve the equation \(5|2 x-1|+8=23\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 279, 700, 296]]<|/det|>
(b) On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y=5 \sin x-2\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[207, 331, 787, 583]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 419, 120]]<|/det|>
6 A curve has equation \(y=\left(\frac{x^{2}-1}{x^{2}+1}\right)^{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 848, 170]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}\) can be written as \(\frac{A x\left(x^{2}-1\right)^{3}}{\left(x^{2}+1\right)^{5}}\), where \(A\) is a positive integer to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 764, 93]]<|/det|>
(b) (i) Show that the curve has stationary points where \(x=-1, x=0\) and \(x=1\). [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 199, 918, 216]]<|/det|>
(ii) Use the first derivative test to determine which two stationary points have the same nature and state whether they are maximum or minimum points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 675, 91]]<|/det|>
7 Solutions to this question by accurate drawing will not be accepted. Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the points where the curve \(y=(2 x-9)\left(x^{2}+5\right)+42\) cuts the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 678, 96]]<|/det|>
8 (a) Write down the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\log _{5}(12 x-4)\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 160, 545, 197]]<|/det|>
(b) Solve the equation \(\log _{5}(12 x-4)=\frac{6}{\log _{x} 125}+1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 451, 614, 468]]<|/det|>
The point \(A\) with \(x\)-coordinate 2 lies on the curve \(y=\sqrt{4 x+1}\). The diagram shows part of this curve and the tangent to the curve at \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 497, 769, 516]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the curve, the tangent and the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 74, 465, 91]]<|/det|>
Continuation of working space for Question 9.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 76, 848, 110]]<|/det|>
10 (a) Given that \(0 \leqslant \theta<\frac{\pi}{2}\), show that \(\frac{\sin \theta}{\sqrt{\operatorname{cosec}^{2} \theta-1}}+\frac{1}{\sqrt{1+\tan ^{2} \theta}}\) can be written as \(\sec \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 490, 708, 520]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that \(\sec x=\alpha\), where \(\frac{3 \pi}{2}<x \leqslant 2 \pi\), find \(\sin x\) in terms of \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 74, 532, 91]]<|/det|>
11 An arithmetic progression has common difference \(d\) ． The 3rd term of this progression is 10.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 121, 758, 138]]<|/det|>
（a）Write down expressions for the 1st term and the 2nd term of this progression． Give your answers in terms of \(d\) only．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 290, 736, 307]]<|/det|>
（b）When each of the first 3 terms is squared，the sum of these squares is 140 ． There are two possible values for \(d\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 336, 918, 352]]<|/det|>
Using your answer to part（a），find the sum of the first 200 terms of the progression with the smaller value of \(d\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 76, 303, 91]]<|/det|>
12 In this question \(n \geqslant 6\). Use an algebraic method to show that \({ }^{n} \mathrm{C}_{5}-{ }^{n-1} \mathrm{C}_{5}\) can be written as \({ }^{n-1} \mathrm{C}_{4}\).
